1{-# LANGUAGE RecordWildCards #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Decimal number.
5--
6--   A decimal number in Koshucode is internally represented
7--   using a rational number ('decimalRatio')
8--   with a length of fractional part ('decimalFracle') .
9--   For example, the decimal number 11.250 correnponds to
10--   the rational number 45/4 with the fraction length 3.
11--
12--   [Decimal number]
13--     Number represented using 10 digits and the decimal separator.
14--   [Decimal separator]
15--     Symbol between integer part and fractional part.
16--   [Fractional part]
17--     The right part of decimal numbers, e.g., 250 for 11.250.
18--   [Integer part]
19--     The left part of decimal numbers, e.g., 11 for 11.250.
20--   [Integral decimal]
21--     Decimal number without fractional part.
22--     
23
24module Koshucode.Baala.Type.Decimal.Decimal
25  ( -- * Decimal
26    DecimalInteger, DecimalRatio,
27    DecimalFracle, Decimal (..),
28    decimalFracleSet,
29    decimalRatioMap,
30
31    -- * Binary
32    BinDecimal, BinAbDecimal,
33    BinFracle, BinRatio,
34    decimalBin, decimalBinAb,
35
36    -- * Conversion
37    integralDecimal,
38    realDecimal,
39    decimalFractional,
40    decimalDouble,
41  ) where
42
43import qualified Data.Ratio                        as R
44import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture          as O
45import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base              as B
46
47
48-- --------------------------------------------  Decimal
49
50-- | Type for numerator or denominator for decimal numbers.
51type DecimalInteger = Integer
52
53-- | Rational number of decimal type.
54type DecimalRatio = R.Ratio DecimalInteger
55
56-- | Length of fractional part.
57type DecimalFracle = Int
58
59-- | Decimal number.
60data Decimal = Decimal 
61    { decimalFracle  :: DecimalFracle  -- ^ Length of the fractional part
62    , decimalRatio   :: DecimalRatio   -- ^ Rational number for the decimal number
63    }
64
65instance Show Decimal where
66    show Decimal {..} = "Decimal (" ++ fracle ++ ") " ++ ratio
67        where fracle = show decimalFracle
68              ratio  = show i ++ showF
69              showF  = if f == 0 then "" else " + " ++ show f
70              (i, f) = properFraction decimalRatio :: (DecimalInteger, DecimalRatio)
71
72-- | Change decimal fracle.
73decimalFracleSet :: DecimalFracle -> B.AbMap Decimal
74decimalFracleSet f d@Decimal {..} = Right $ d { decimalFracle = f }
75
76-- | Map function to rational number in decimal.
77decimalRatioMap :: O.Map DecimalRatio -> O.Map Decimal
78decimalRatioMap f d@Decimal {..} = d { decimalRatio = f decimalRatio }
79
80
81-- --------------------------------------------  Binary
82
83-- | Binary operation for two decimals.
84type BinDecimal = O.Bin Decimal
85
86-- | Abortable binary operation for two decimals.
87type BinAbDecimal = B.BinAb Decimal
88
89-- | Combinate fracle.
90type BinFracle = O.Bin DecimalFracle
91
92-- | Combinate rational number.
93type BinRatio = O.Bin DecimalRatio
94
95-- | Binary operation for two decimals.
96decimalBin :: BinFracle -> BinRatio -> BinDecimal
97decimalBin frac bin
98      Decimal { decimalFracle = f1, decimalRatio = r1 }
99      Decimal { decimalFracle = f2, decimalRatio = r2 }
100    = Decimal { decimalFracle = frac f1 f2
101              , decimalRatio  = bin r1 r2 }
102
103-- | Abortable binary operation for two decimals.
104decimalBinAb :: BinFracle -> BinRatio -> BinAbDecimal
105decimalBinAb frac bin x y = Right $ decimalBin frac bin x y
106
107
108-- --------------------------------------------  Conversion
109
110-- | Convert integral number to integral decimal number.
111integralDecimal :: (Integral n) => n -> Decimal
112integralDecimal = realDecimal 0
113
114-- | Convert real number to decimal number.
115realDecimal :: (Real n) => DecimalFracle -> n -> Decimal
116realDecimal f n = Decimal { decimalFracle = f
117                          , decimalRatio  = toRational n }
118
119-- | Convert decimal number to fractional number.
120decimalFractional :: (Fractional n) => Decimal -> n
121decimalFractional = fromRational . decimalRatio
122
123-- | Convert decimal number to double.
124decimalDouble :: Decimal -> Double
125decimalDouble = decimalFractional
126
127
128-- --------------------------------------------  Instance
129
130-- | Test numerical equality of two decimal numbers.
131decimalRatioEq :: Decimal -> Decimal -> Bool
132decimalRatioEq x y = decimalRatio x == decimalRatio y
133
134-- | Test numerical order of two decimal numbers.
135decimalRatioCompare :: Decimal -> Decimal -> Ordering
136decimalRatioCompare x y = decimalRatio x `compare` decimalRatio y
137
138-- | Decompose decimal into integer part and fraction part.
139decimalIntFrac :: (Integral n) => Decimal -> (n, Decimal)
140decimalIntFrac d = (i, dec f) where
141    (i, f) = properFraction $ decimalRatio d
142    dec r  = decimalRatioMap (const r) d
143
144-- Basic
145
146instance Eq Decimal where
147    (==)           = decimalRatioEq
148
149instance Ord Decimal where
150    compare        = decimalRatioCompare
151
152instance Enum Decimal where
153    toEnum         = fromIntegral
154    fromEnum       = fromInteger . truncate
155    succ d         = d + 1
156    pred d         = d - 1
157
158-- Numeric
159
160instance Num Decimal where
161    (+)            = decimalBin max (+)
162    (-)            = decimalBin max (-)
163    (*)            = decimalBin (+) (*)
164    negate         = decimalRatioMap negate
165    abs            = decimalRatioMap abs
166    signum         = realDecimal 0 . signum . decimalRatio
167    fromInteger    = realDecimal 0
168
169instance Real Decimal where
170    toRational = decimalRatio
171
172instance Fractional Decimal where
173    (/)            = decimalBin (+) (/)
174    recip          = decimalRatioMap recip
175    fromRational   = realDecimal 0
176
177instance RealFrac Decimal where
178    properFraction = decimalIntFrac
179
